Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Batroxicidin (BatxC; Vipericidins, Lys-rich; cell-penetrating; natural AMPs; cathelicidins; snake, reptiles, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: venom gland, South American pit vipers,Bothrops atrox

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: 91.17% similar toAP897 NA-CATH. Rich in lysines (32%).Activity: active against Gram+ E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 7.7-30.8 uM), S. aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC 7.7 uM), S. pyogenes clinical isolate (MIC 3.8 uM), S. aureus (MIC 7.7 uM), Gram- P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 0.2-3.8 uM), K. pneumoniae clinical isolate (MIC 1.9 uM), E. coli ATCC 25922  (MIC 0.06-3.8 uM), and A. baumannii clinical isolate (MIC 3.8 uM).  Also active against T. cruzi, a protozoan that causes  Chagas' disease (Mello et al., 2017). T. cruzi cell labeling by 7-aminoactinomycin D, the increase in reactive oxygen species and the loss of mitochondrial membrane potential when the parasite was treated with BatxC, which are indication of necrosis.Appeared to have proinflammatory effect on immune cells such as Raw 264.7 cells (Oliveira-Júnior et al., 2018).Reg. 8/2014; Updated 3/2017; 11/2023; 12/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Falcao CB, de La Torre BG, Pérez-Peinado C, Barron AE, Andreu D, Rádis-Baptista G.2014
Literature Information.Title: Vipericidins: a novel family of cathelicidin-related peptides from the venom gland of South American pit vipers.
